properties.areaDesc: Waters from Florence to Cape Blanco OR from 10 to 60 nm; Coastal waters from Cape Blanco OR to Pt. St. George CA out 10 nm; Waters from Cape Blanco OR to Pt. St. George CA from 10 to 60 nm
properties.headline: Gale Warning issued January 26 at 2:54PM PST until January 28 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Medford OR
properties.description:
* WHAT...For the Gale Warning on Monday, south winds 30 to 35 kt
with gusts up to 45 kt and seas 15 to 18 ft due to a mix of west
swell at 16 seconds and short period wind seas are expected,
manly from Cape Sebastian north. For Small Craft Advisory today
through Monday morning, south winds 20 to 30 kt and seas 12 to
16 ft at 16 seconds then small craft advisory winds and seas
will continue through Monday night for southwest portions of
the waters. Tuesday through Thursday, expect southwest to south
winds 15 to 30 kt and seas 12 to 15 ft at 13 seconds building to
14 to 16 ft at 18 seconds Thursday.

* WHERE...The Small Craft Advisory is for all areas. The Gale
Warning is for areas from Cape Blanco northward and between Cape
Sebastian to Cape Blanco within 30 NM of the coast late Monday
morning through Monday night. Elsewhere on Monday, expect steep
seas and small craft advisory winds.

* WHEN...For the Gale Warning, from 10 AM Monday to 4 AM PST
Tuesday. For the Small Craft Advisory, until 10 AM PST Monday.
For the Small Craft Advisory, from 4 AM Tuesday to 10 PM PST
Thursday.

* View the hazard area in detail at
https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/mfr/HAZARD
properties.instruction:
Mariners should alter plans to avoid strong winds and very steep
seas. Remain in port, seek safe harbor, alter course, and/or
secure the vessel for severe conditions.

NWSheadline: SMALL CRAFT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST THURSDAY... ...GALE WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM MONDAY TO 4 AM PST TUESDAY
